questions.text: What did John McLaughlin say "Cheers" was rated in its first season?
questions.explanation:
77 out of 77 shows.

	"Cheers" got off to a very rocky start and was actually last in the ratings its first season. Thankfully the powers that be believed in it enough not to cancel it.

questions.text: What did George Wendt say about Norm?
options: He's got a really big gut.
questions.explanation:
He's got darn good writers.

	"Cheers" has had many writers during its 11 season run. Some of these writers include: James Burrows, Glen Burrows, Les Burrows, Dan O'Shannon and Tom Anderson.

questions.text: I won't be evil and make this a fill in the blank, but tell me, what is Carla's full name?
questions.correct: Carla Marie Victoria Angelina Teresa Apollonia Luzapone Tortelli LeBec
options: Carla Mary Vicki Andrea Toni Alexandria Luzapone Tortelli LeBec
Carla Mindy Valerie Abigail Tiffany Anna Luzapone Tortelli LeBec
Carla Martha Vanessa Amy Tracy, April Luzapone Tortelli LeBec
questions.explanation:
Carla Marie Victoria Angelina Teresa Apollonia Luzapone Tortelli LeBec.

	Carla was a Roman Catholic. As is common with Italians she was Christened with several names. Luzapone was her married name, Tortelli came from her marriage to Nick, and LeBec came from her marriage to Eddie.

questions.text: What part of Cliff did John Ratzenberger say was in him?
options: He wanted to be a postman growing up.
He is too attached to his mother.
questions.explanation:
He wears white socks.

	In the episode "Tan N Wash" Cliff showed how white he was before he used the tanning. However, he left his white socks on when he went in.

questions.text: What did James Burrows say was on the set that belonged to Nicholas Colassanto?
questions.explanation:
a picture of Geronimo.

	Nicholas Colasanto played Ernie "Coach" Pantusso in the earlier seasons of "Cheers". However, in 1985 Colasanto died from a heart attack. After his death they placed his picture of Geronimo on one of the walls in the bar.

questions.text: What did Kelsey Grammar say Frasier's philosophy was?
questions.correct: He would like to heal the human condition.
options: He would like to buy all his friends a drink.
He would like to make everyone feel warm and fuzzy.
He would like to make all men be carefree when it came to women.
questions.explanation:
He would like to heal the human condition.

	Frasier believed he was a great psychiatrist. However, he never actually cured/helped anyone.

questions.text: When John McLaughlin asked "did psychiatrist Frasier Crane provide services for Diane Chambers", how did Ted Danson reply?
options: Only until I was able to take over.
Yes, he was very helpful for her.
questions.explanation:
No, that was my job.

	Of course, John McLaughlin was referring to psychiatric services. Ted Danson was commenting however, on his character Sam Malone's sexual advances he was always making on Diane (and the fact that off and on they were dating, and even engaged).

questions.text: What did Kirstie Alley do in one of the episodes that made writer Cheri Eicken say she had hidden talent?
questions.correct: Put the lit end of a cigarette in her mouth
options: Played the 3 card Monte on her
questions.explanation:
Put the lit end of a cigarette in her mouth.

	This was the episode in which Rebecca Howe was trying to quit smoking. Kirstie Alley won the role of Rebecca when she went to auditions dressed as Shelley Long (who played Diane Chambers in the earlier seasons of "Cheers").

questions.text: What did Ted Danson say about Sam and Rebecca?
options: They were the best ones in the bar.
questions.explanation:
They were equally shallow.

	This is quite true as all Sam Malone thinks about his his hair and sex. All Rebecca thinks about is how to become rich.

questions.text: What did Ted Danson say Sam Malone's philosophy of life was?
questions.explanation:
Service the queen bee.

	Once again, he was referring to Sam's obsession with sex. Sam believed it was his job to make as many women as he could happy sexually speaking.
